summary: App project "arunodaya"; user indicates they want it for jewelry (jewellery-related use case).
imageRequirements:
## Edit Images
- Add subtle jewellery motifs while keeping the existing brand style (arunodaya-logo.dim_512x512.png > arunodaya-logo-jewellery.dim_512x512.png)
- Make the app icon read as jewellery-themed at small sizes (arunodaya-icon.dim_256x256.png > arunodaya-icon-jewellery.dim_256x256.png)
- Shift the hero background from abstract sunrise to an elegant jewellery-themed background (arunodaya-hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png > arunodaya-hero-bg-jewellery.dim_1920x1080.png)

existing_features.title: Set the application name to “Arunodaya” across the frontend (page title/metadata and any visible app header/branding).
Create a minimal landing page for Arunodaya with a clear hero section (app name + short placeholder tagline), and a small section describing that features are “Coming soon” (English text).
Apply a single, coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) consistently across the landing page; do not use a blue/purple primary palette.

Add the required generated images to the frontend as static assets and use them in the UI (e.g., logo in header/hero, icon as favicon/app icon where applicable) from `frontend/public/assets/generated`.

Update the landing page (header/hero/sections) copy and content so the app is clearly positioned for a jewellery-related use case, while keeping the app name “Arunodaya”. All user-facing text must be in English.
Update site metadata text to match the jewellery positioning (e.g., the HTML meta description) while keeping the title as “Arunodaya”. All user-facing text must be in English.
Replace non-jewellery visual cues used in the landing page content (e.g., icons used in feature cards/badges) with jewellery-appropriate icons, while keeping the overall layout coherent.

new_feature_requests.summary: Adjust the app/landing page content and positioning to be for a jewellery-related use case (jewelry).
